It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant has compact, mat-forming growth habit with small, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Oxydectes adpressa is well adapted to drought conditions, making it a resilient species in harsh environments.
